name: Barbecued Bratwurst with Grilled Onions and Peppers
description: Anyone can be a grill master, all you need is the right tools! Grill pans are great investment if you’re someone who loves spending their summers by the ‘cue. They can be used to cook anything from steak to veggies to potatoes, and give you good charring on the grill with less oil. No grill pan? Wrap food in tin foil packets to cook.
preparation: In a medium mixing bowl, whisk oil with Rub. Add onion and pepper and toss to coat.
Place vegetables in a grill pan and begin to grill.
Pierce each sausage with a fork and lay them in the centre of mesh grilling pan. Continue to grill for 10–15 minutes, turning with tongs and shaking pan often.
Halfway through cooking time, using basting brush, brush sausages with mustard or sauce.

products.name: Montreal Steak Rub
summary: Make it a steak night! Generously rub this low sodium blend on steak to create a beautiful, caramelized crust – or mix it with equal parts oil for a peppery marinade.

products.name: Honey Mustard
summary: A bold twist on a classic condiment made with 100% Canadian mustard seed and organic honey.

products.name: Teppanyaki Sauce Mix
summary: With a garlic-ginger and sesame flavour, Teppanyaki is the ultimate combination of salty, sweet, and umami. Inspired by ever-popular Japanese steak sauce, we make ours healthier – it's free from xanthan gum, lactic acid, and potassium sorbate (and made without eggs) – so you can liberally drizzle it all over perfectly grilled meat and veggies. Just mix it with pantry staples and savour the flavour.
